metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Daman Superstation from January 1 to December 31, 2018. The site (100.372° E, 38.856° N) was located on a cropland (maize surface) in the Daman irrigation, which is near Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (AV-14TH;3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, and 40 m, towards north), wind speed and direction profile (windsonic; 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, and 40 m, towards north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 2.5 m, 8 m in west of tower), four-component radiometer (PIR&PSP; 12 m, towards south), two infrared temperature sensors (IRTC3; 12 m, towards south, vertically downward), photosynthetically active radiation (LI190SB; 12 m, towards south, vertically upward; another four photosynthetically active radiation, PQS-1; two above the plants (12 m) and two below the plants (0.3 m), towards south, each with one vertically downward and one vertically upward), soil heat flux (HFP01SC; 3 duplicates with G1 below the vegetation; G2 and G3 between plants, -0.06 m), a TCAV averaging soil thermocouple probe (TCAV; -0.02, -0.04 m), soil temperature profile (AV-10T; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m), soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_3 m, Ta_5 m, Ta_10 m, Ta_15 m, Ta_20 m, Ta_30 m, and Ta_40 m; RH_3 m, RH_5 m, RH_10 m, RH_15 m, RH_20 m, RH_30 m, and RH_40 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_3 m, Ws_5 m, Ws_10 m, Ws_15 m, Ws_20 m, Ws_30 m, and Ws_40 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_3 m, WD_5 m, WD_10 m, WD_15 m, WD_20 m, WD_30m, and WD_40 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (μmol/ (s m-2)), average soil temperature (TCAV, ℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, below the vegetation; Gs_2, and Gs_3, between plants) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, and Ts_160 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, and Ms_160 cm) (%, volumetric water content), above the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_U_up and PAR_U_down) (μmol/ (s m-2)), and below the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_D_up and PAR_D_down) (μmol/ (s m-2)).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day.The meterological data during September 17 and November 7 and TCAV data after November 7 were wrong because the malfunction of datalogger. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2018-6-10 10:30. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2018年1月1日至2018年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游大满超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米田。观测点的经纬度是100.3722E, 38.8555N，海拔1556m。风速/风向、空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在3m、5m、10m、15m、20m、30m、40m处，共7层，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在塔西侧约8m处，架高2.5m；四分量辐射仪安装在12m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在12m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，朝向正南距离塔体2m处，其中两块（Gs_2、Gs_3）埋设在棵间，一块（Gs_1）埋设在植株下面；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，朝向正南，距离塔体2m处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；光合有效辐射仪安装在12m处，探头朝向是垂直向上；另有四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在12m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.3m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：风速（WS_3m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_30m、WS_40m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_3m、WD_5m、WD_10m、WD_15m、WD_20m、WD_30m、WD_40m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_3m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_30m、Ta_40m和RH_3m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_30m、RH_40m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度) 、光合有效辐射（PAR）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2018.9.17-11.7由于采集器的问题，气象梯度部分的数据缺失；由于采集器通道问题，平均土壤温度TCAV数据在11月7日后数据不正确。（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2018-6-10 10:30。
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测，这些参数和观测无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估计蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组分温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组分温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站——2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Feature Specification.AnswerEn: two-source models, separates soil and canopy components, accurately estimating component temperatures and fluxes, mixed landscape conditions, surface-air temperature differences, errors in classification of thermal images into soil and canopy pixels, accuracy of temperature and flux estimations
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 双源模型，分离土壤和冠层成分，准确估算成分温度和通量，混合景观条件，地表-空气温度差异，热图像中土壤和冠层像素分类错误，温度和通量估算的准确性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with accurately estimating surface fluxes in arid agricultural areas using the eddy covariance system?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱农业地区使用涡度协方差系统准确估计表面通量时，面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in arid agricultural areas using the eddy covariance system is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy. Errors in surface-air temperature differences and classification errors in component temperatures can lead to uncertainties in flux estimations. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions can exacerbate these challenges, affecting the accuracy of flux measurements such as sensible and latent heat fluxes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱农业地区，使用涡度协方差系统准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为相对于可用能量，能量平衡的闭合性不完整。表面与空气温度差的误差以及成分温度的分类错误可能导致通量估计的不确定性。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境可能加剧这些挑战，影响感热和潜热通量等通量测量的准确性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the term 'oasis–desert system' refer to in the context of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: “绿洲–沙漠系统”在能源、水汽和碳交换研究中指的是一个特定的生态系统，其中绿洲区域与周围的沙漠环境之间存在着相互作用和能量、水分及碳的交换。
Definition.AnswerEn: The term 'oasis–desert system' refers to the unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas where oases are surrounded by deserts. These systems are crucial for maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity in such regions. Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems is important for achieving ecological security and sustainable development, as they play a significant role in the regional and global carbon cycles.
Definition.AnswerCn: “绿洲-沙漠系统”一词指的是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，其中绿洲被沙漠包围。这些系统对于维持生态稳定和农业生产力至关重要。理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于实现生态安全和可持续发展非常重要，因为它们在区域和全球碳循环中发挥着重要作用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the Daman superstation compare to those used in other oasis–desert systems in terms of capturing soil and canopy component temperatures?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Daman超级站使用的数据收集方法与其他绿洲-沙漠系统在捕捉土壤和冠层组件温度方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Daman superstation uses a combination of meteorological measurements and a high-resolution thermal camera to capture soil and canopy component temperatures, while other oasis–desert systems utilize eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, as well as automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 达曼超级站结合气象测量和高分辨率热成像相机来捕捉土壤和树冠组件的温度，而其他绿洲-沙漠系统则利用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站获取水文气象数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences in the challenges faced in estimating evapotranspiration in arid agricultural areas compared to oasis–desert ecosystems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱农业地区与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，估算蒸散发所面临的挑战有哪些相似之处和不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both arid agricultural areas and oasis–desert ecosystems face challenges related to heterogeneous landscapes and measurement errors. However, arid agricultural areas specifically struggle with advective conditions affecting flux measurements, while oasis–desert ecosystems contend with broader ecological degradation issues and the balance of carbon exchange.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 干旱农业地区和绿洲-沙漠生态系统都面临与异质景观和测量误差相关的挑战。然而，干旱农业地区特别受到影响，面临着影响通量测量的对流条件，而绿洲-沙漠生态系统则面临更广泛的生态退化问题和碳交换平衡的挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the use of multisource observational data enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多源观测数据的使用如何增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of various data sources such as eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations provides comprehensive measurements of turbulent fluxes, hydrometeorological parameters, and soil and vegetation characteristics. This multi-faceted approach can improve the accuracy and depth of understanding regarding the interactions of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in these ecosystems, offering insights into ecological stability and socioeconomic impacts.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 各种数据源的整合，如涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，提供了对湍流通量、水文气象参数以及土壤和植被特征的全面测量。这种多方面的方法可以提高对能量、水蒸气和碳交换相互作用的准确性和理解深度，为生态稳定性和社会经济影响提供了洞察。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can long-term observational datasets contribute to the sustainable development of oasis–desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集可以通过以下方式促进干旱和半干旱地区绿洲-沙漠系统的可持续发展：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term datasets capturing energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with hydrometeorological and soil parameters, offer critical insights into the ecological dynamics of oasis–desert systems. These datasets enable researchers to understand and monitor the balance between oasis and desert systems, helping to maintain ecological stability, support sustainable agricultural practices, and contribute to carbon neutrality goals in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期数据集捕捉能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及水文气象和土壤参数，为研究绿洲-沙漠系统的生态动态提供了重要的见解。这些数据集使研究人员能够理解和监测绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，有助于维持生态稳定，支持可持续农业实践，并为这些地区的碳中和目标做出贡献。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the need for rigorous data quality control when collecting meteorological and surface process data in the Heihe River Basin?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在收集黑河流域的气象和地表过程数据时，哪些因素导致对数据质量控制的严格需求？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Factors contributing to the need for rigorous data quality control include the complexity of the surface heterogeneity, data loss due to equipment failures such as the data collector issues, the presence of environmental elements that may affect sensor readings, and the need to maintain a high frequency of data collection (every 10 minutes) to ensure temporal accuracy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 导致对严格数据质量控制需求的因素包括表面异质性的复杂性、由于设备故障（如数据采集器问题）导致的数据丢失、可能影响传感器读数的环境因素，以及需要保持高频率的数据采集（每10分钟一次）以确保时间准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to estimate evapotranspiration accurately in irrigated agricultural areas using models like the TSEB?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在使用像TSEB这样的模型在灌溉农业地区准确估计蒸散发时，面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Estimating evapotranspiration accurately is challenging due to the strong advective conditions in irrigated areas, which can affect the surface-air temperature difference, and the errors in determining soil and vegetation temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. These challenges can lead to inaccuracies in component temperature calculations and subsequent energy balance estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 准确估计蒸散发是具有挑战性的，因为在灌溉区强烈的平流条件会影响表面与空气之间的温度差，并且从复合辐射温度中确定土壤和植被温度的误差。这些挑战可能导致成分温度计算和随后的能量平衡估计的不准确。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What potential challenges and outcomes arise from implementing long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert ecosystems for carbon and water vapor exchange studies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中实施长期观测数据集以研究碳和水蒸气交换时，可能会出现哪些挑战和结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert ecosystems presents challenges such as data management, quality control, and accounting for ecological variability. However, it results in valuable insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, supporting ecological stability and sustainable development in these regions. Such datasets are crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions and informing policies for carbon neutrality and ecological security.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中实施长期观测数据集面临数据管理、质量控制和生态变异性等挑战。然而，这些数据集为能量、水蒸气和碳交换提供了宝贵的见解，支持这些地区的生态稳定和可持续发展。这些数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及为碳中和和生态安全政策提供信息至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to use meteorological and hydrometeorological data collected from multiple station setups for understanding oasis–desert interactions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用多个站点收集的气象和水文气象数据对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development. Long-term observations from multiple stations provide a quantitative understanding of these exchanges, which is essential to achieving carbon neutrality and ecological security in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换对于维持生态稳定和支持可持续发展至关重要。来自多个站点的长期观测提供了对这些交换的定量理解，这对于实现碳中和和干旱地区的生态安全至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals are pursued by employing the TSEB model with soil and canopy component temperatures to estimate evapotranspiration in irrigated agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 采用TSEB模型结合土壤和冠层组件温度来估算灌溉农业区域的蒸散发，追求的目标有哪些？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to achieve better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimations using soil and canopy component temperatures. This approach aims to improve the accuracy of ET measurements, which can be crucial for water resource management and understanding the water cycle in heterogeneous landscapes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过土壤和冠层组件温度更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。这种方法旨在提高蒸散发测量的准确性，这对水资源管理和理解异质景观中的水循环至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind collecting long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to gain insights into the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange within these ecosystems. This understanding supports the ecological security and sustainable development of oases, providing necessary data for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability of these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是深入了解这些生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征。这种理解支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展，为识别绿洲与沙漠的相互作用以及保护这些地区的生态稳定性提供必要的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are utilized to integrate ground-based measurements with remote sensing data for comprehensive evapotranspiration analysis in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，整合地面测量与遥感数据以进行全面的蒸散发分析所采用的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Comprehensive evapotranspiration analysis in heterogeneous landscapes involves integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data by using models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. Ground measurements, such as meteorological parameters and soil heat fluxes, are combined with high-resolution thermal images to calculate soil and canopy component temperatures. The data are processed to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration fractions, which are then validated using stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance system measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中进行全面的蒸散发分析涉及将地面测量与遥感数据结合，使用如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等模型。地面测量数据，如气象参数和土壤热通量，与高分辨率热图像结合，以计算土壤和冠层组件的温度。数据经过处理，以将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾两个部分，然后使用稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差系统测量进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够在异质景观中准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, obtained via a high-resolution thermal camera, enable the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration. These temperatures are then used as inputs to a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which is validated with eddy covariance system measurements and stable isotope techniques.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过高分辨率热像仪获得的地面测量土壤和冠层组件温度，使得能够准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。这些温度随后作为输入用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，该模型通过涡度协方差系统测量和稳定同位素技术进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do technological advancements in thermal imaging contribute to the separation of soil and canopy temperatures in agricultural research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 技术进步在热成像方面如何有助于农业研究中土壤和树冠温度的分离？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras, such as the Fluke Ti55, are manually operated on platforms to capture thermal radiation images of cropland. These images help in classifying soil and canopy pixels using methods like the maximum-likelihood method, which in turn allows for the extraction of soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures, enhancing the separation of these temperatures for research.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 热红外相机，如Fluke Ti55，手动操作在平台上捕捉农田的热辐射图像。这些图像有助于使用最大似然法等方法对土壤和冠层像素进行分类，从而提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度，增强这些温度的分离，以便于研究。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing techniques are essential for ensuring the quality and accuracy of long-term hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 确保绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期水文气象数据质量和准确性所需的关键数据处理技术有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing techniques include the collection, processing, and archiving of data from various sources like eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations. Quality control involves ensuring data completeness, removing duplicate records, and eliminating data that exceed physical or instrumental limits, with specific handling for missing or questionable data points.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理技术包括从各种来源（如涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站）收集、处理和归档数据。质量控制涉及确保数据的完整性，去除重复记录，以及消除超出物理或仪器限制的数据，并对缺失或可疑的数据点进行特定处理。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods in arid and semi-arid regions face challenges in accurately measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集方法在准确测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换方面可能面临挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in such areas are facing ecological degradation issues like drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, and intensified land desertification, which complicate data collection efforts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及加剧的土地沙漠化，这使得数据收集工作变得更加复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in achieving accurate data collection for soil and canopy temperatures in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强烈的对流农业区域中，实现土壤和冠层温度准确数据收集的预期挑战是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and errors in determining component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures are significant challenges, especially in strongly advective environments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 表面空气温度差异的不确定性以及从复合辐射温度中确定组成温度的误差是一个重大挑战，尤其是在强烈的平流环境中。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why could there be difficulties in separating soil and canopy latent heat fluxes in data collection methods over heterogeneous landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，分离土壤和冠层潜热通量的困难可能源于数据收集方法的局限性。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The separation is challenging due to image classification errors that misidentify soil and vegetation pixels, affecting canopy temperature estimates, and the uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation through the canopy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 分离过程面临挑战，因为图像分类错误将土壤和植被像素误识别，从而影响冠层温度估计，并且在通过冠层估计入射短波和长波辐射时存在不确定性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of data collection methods employed for measuring soil and canopy temperatures in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中用于测量土壤和冠层温度的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The methods used for measuring soil and canopy temperatures in oasis–desert ecosystems appear to be effective as they involve high-resolution thermal cameras and thermal infrared technology. This ensures precise temperature readings necessary for modeling evapotranspiration processes in arid regions. However, limitations exist due to image classification errors, especially with varying vegetation abundance, which could affect the accuracy of temperature estimations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，用于测量土壤和冠层温度的方法似乎是有效的，因为它们涉及高分辨率热像仪和热红外技术。这确保了在干旱地区建模蒸散发过程所需的精确温度读数。然而，由于图像分类错误，尤其是在植被丰度变化的情况下，存在一定的局限性，这可能会影响温度估算的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges identified in collecting reliable data for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠地区能源、水汽和碳交换的可靠数据时，主要面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenges in collecting reliable data in oasis–desert areas include ecological degradation such as drying up of rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors can complicate long-term data collection efforts and impact the quality and reliability of the data collected.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区收集可靠数据的主要挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会使长期数据收集工作变得复杂，并影响所收集数据的质量和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't understand how data quality control is effectively maintained in the collection of meteorological data over a year-long period.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在一年期间如何有效维护气象数据收集中的数据质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality control in the collection of meteorological data is maintained through several measures: ensuring consistent data points daily (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with a specific indicator, removing duplicate records, deleting data that exceeds physical or instrument limits, and uniformly formatting date and time.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 气象数据收集中的数据质量控制通过几个措施来维护：确保每天（每10分钟）收集一致的数据点，用特定指示符标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，以及统一格式化日期和时间。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about what methodologies are used for accurately estimating soil and vegetation component temperatures in complex ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在复杂生态系统中用于准确估计土壤和植被成分温度的方法论。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating soil and vegetation component temperatures involves using thermal infrared cameras to obtain soil and canopy component temperatures, classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels, and converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures by considering incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 准确估计土壤和植被成分的温度涉及使用热红外相机获取土壤和树冠成分的温度，将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和树冠像素，并通过考虑入射长波辐射和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems and propose solutions based on current data collection practices.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换的挑战，并基于当前的数据收集实践提出解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges include dealing with heterogeneous landscapes and the complex interaction between soil and vegetation.
